010package Ch05_Edges_Contours;
011
012import java.awt.Color;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
016import ij.process.Blitter;
017import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
018import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * ImageJ plugin implementing a simple Sobel-type edge operator.
024 * This implementation uses built-in ImageJ functionality only.
025 * The plugin displays the two derivative images ("Ix", "Iy"),
026 * edge magnitude and orientation ("E", "phi"), and
027 * color-coded edge magnitude ("E colors", hue controlled by edge orientation).
028 * Edge magnitude is &ge; 0, orientation is in [&minus;&pi;,+&pi;].
029 * See Sec. 5.3.1 of [1] for additional details.
030 * </p>
031 * <p>
032 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
033 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * @author WB
036 *
037 */
038public class Sobel_Edges_Colored implements PlugInFilter {
039        
040        /** The 2D Sobel kernel for the derivative filter in x-direction. */
041    public static final float[] sobelX = {
042                -1, 0, 1,
043            -2, 0, 2,
044            -1, 0, 1 };
045    
046    /** The 2D Sobel kernel for the derivative filter in y-direction. */
047    public static final float[] sobelY = {
048                        -1, -2, -1,
049                         0,  0,  0,
050                         1,  2,  1 };
051
052    @Override
053        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus I) {
054        return DOES_8G + PlugInFilter.NO_CHANGES;
055    }
056
057    @Override
058        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
059        FloatProcessor Ix = (FloatProcessor) ip.convertToFloat();
060        FloatProcessor Iy = (FloatProcessor) Ix.duplicate();
061        Ix.convolve(sobelX, 3, 3);
062        Iy.convolve(sobelY, 3, 3);
063        
064        (new ImagePlus("Ix", Ix)).show();
065        (new ImagePlus("Iy", Iy)).show();
066        
067        FloatProcessor Ix2 = (FloatProcessor) Ix.duplicate(); Ix2.sqr();
068        FloatProcessor Iy2 = (FloatProcessor) Iy.duplicate(); Iy2.sqr();
069        
070        FloatProcessor E = (FloatProcessor) Ix2.duplicate();
071        E.copyBits(Iy2, 0, 0, Blitter.ADD);
072        E.sqrt();
073        
074        FloatProcessor Phi = makeOrientation(Ix, Iy);
075        
076        ColorProcessor cp = makeColorEdges(E, Phi);
077       
078        (new ImagePlus("E", E)).show();
079        (new ImagePlus("Phi", Phi)).show();
080        (new ImagePlus("E Colors", cp)).show();
081    }
082    
083    FloatProcessor makeOrientation(FloatProcessor fpx, FloatProcessor fpy) {
084        FloatProcessor orient = (FloatProcessor) fpx.duplicate();
085        int M = fpx.getPixelCount();
086        for (int i=0; i<M; i++) {
087                double dx = fpx.getf(i);
088                double dy = fpy.getf(i);
089                float phi = (float) Math.atan2(dy, dx);
090                orient.setf(i, phi);
091        }
092                return orient;
093    }
094    
095    ColorProcessor makeColorEdges(FloatProcessor mag, FloatProcessor ort) {
096        // edge magnitude is all positive, orientation is in -pi ... +pi
097        int w = mag.getWidth();
098        int h = mag.getHeight();
099        int M = mag.getPixelCount();
100        mag.resetMinAndMax();
101        ort.resetMinAndMax();
102        double maxMag = mag.getMax();
103
104        int[] colorPixels = new int[M];
105        for (int i=0; i<M; i++) {
106                float m = mag.getf(i);
107                float p = ort.getf(i);
108                float hue = (float)(p / (2 * Math.PI)) + 1;
109                float saturation = (float) (m / maxMag); //1;
110                float brightness = 1; //(float) (m / maxMag);
111                colorPixels[i] = Color.HSBtoRGB( hue, saturation, brightness);
112        }
113        return new ColorProcessor(w,h,colorPixels);
114    }
115   
116
117}
